translation: Speech of Balram addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: kiRpwisMD ieh kaun suq KVg isMG ijh nwm ] AYso ApunI bYs mY nih dyKXo bl Dwm ]1724]
transliteration: Kridaasindh Eh Kaoun Sout Khadag Singh Jih Naam|| Aiso Apounibais Mai Nah(i) Dekhyo Bal Dhaam||1724||
translation: “O the ocean of mercy ! who was this king Kharag Singh? I have not seen till now such a powerful hero.1724.

gurmukhi: qw qy Xw kI kQw pRkwso ] myry mn ko Brmu ibnwso ] AYsI ibD sO bl jb khXo ] suin sRI kiRSin mon hÍY rhXo ]1725]
transliteration: Taa Te Yaa Kikathaa Prakaaso|| Dere Man Ko Bharm(u) Binaaso|| Aisibidh Sau Bal Jab Kahyo|| Soun(i) Srikrishan(i) Mon Hvai Rahyo||1725||
translation: “Therefore telling me his episode, remove the illusion of my mind;” when Balram said this, Krishna listening to him, remained silent.1725.

gurmukhi: puin bolXo biRjnwQ kiRpwvMq hÍY bMD isau ] suin bl Xw kI gwQ jnm kQw BUpq kho ]1726]
transliteration: Poun(i) Bolyo Brijnaath Kridaavant Hvai Bandh Sio|| Soun(i) Bal Yaa Kigadth Janam Kathaa Bhoopat Kaho||1726||
translation: Then Krishna gracefully said to his brother, “O Balram ! now I relate the story of the birth of the king, listen to it;1726.

gurmukhi: Kt muK rmw gnyS puin isM|I irK Gn sXwm ] Awd brn ibiD pMc lY DrXo KVg isMG nwm ]1727]
transliteration: Khat Moukh Ramaa Gadesh Poun(i) Singirikh Ghan Syaam|| Ood Baran Bidh(i) Panch Lai Ddaryo Khadag Singh Naam||1727||
translation: “Kartikeya (the six-faced), Rama, Ganesh, Shringi and Ghanshyam taking the first letters of these names, he was named Kharag Singh.1727.

gurmukhi: Krg rmX qn grimqw isMG nwd Gmswn ] pMc brn ko gun lIE ieh BUpq blvwn ]1728]
transliteration: Kharag Ramay Tan Garmitaa Singh Naad Ghamsaan ? Panchbaran K? Goun Leeo Ih Bhoopat Balvaan ?1728?

gurmukhi: Krg Skiq iSv qwq deI iqh hyq jIq Aiq ] bhu suMdrqw rmw deI iqn ibml Aml miq ]
transliteration: Khadag Shakati Shiv Taat Daitih Het Jeet At(i)|| Bahu Soundartaa Ramaa Daitin Bimal Amal Mattee||
translation: “Shiva gave him the sword of victory in the war; Lakshmi gave him the beauty of the body and pure intellect;
